data.title: University of Illinois Chicago
data.text:
History AP Elizabeth Todd-Breland appointed as distinguished lecturer by Organization of American Historians

Associate Professor of History Elizabeth Todd-Breland was appointed as a distinguished lecturer by the Organization of American Historians, the largest professional society dedicated to the teaching and study of American history. She joins…

Senior Lecturer of English Margena Christian selected for Public Voices Fellowship

Senior Lecturer Margena Christian was selected to be a part of the 2022-2023 cohort for the Public Voices Fellowship! This program is part of a national initiative to help faculty amplify their expertise…

Chemistry Professor Michael Trenary wins 2022 Outstanding Researcher Award from American Vacuum Society

Chemistry Professor Michael Trenary has won the 2022 Outstanding Researcher Award from American Vacuum Society, Prairie Chapter! This award is given to individuals who have outstanding theoretical or experimental research accomplishments in a…

Computer Science AP Joseph Michaelis receives NSF grant for teacher/student support robots

Assistant Professor of Computer Science and UIC’s Learning Sciences Research Institute Joseph Michaelis received a grant from the National Science Foundation for his project, “Collaborative Research: HCC: Small: PATHWiSE – Supporting Teacher Authoring…

Professor/Department Head of Mathematics, Statistics, and Computer Science Brooke Shipley awarded Senior Berwick Prize from London Math Society

Professor and Department Head of Mathematics, Statistics, and Computer Science Brooke Shipley was awarded the London Math Society’s 2022 Senior Berwick Prize for her paper with John Greenlees, ‘An algebraic model for rational…

Political Science Professor Emeritus Dick Simpson named recipient of APSA Distinguished Teaching Award

University of Illinois Chicago political scientist Dick Simpson was named the recipient of the American Political Science Association’s 2022 Distinguished Teaching Award, which annually recognizes outstanding contributions to undergraduate and graduate teaching of…

Chemistry AP Ruixuan Gao wins McKnight Award for neuroscience innovations

Ruixuan Gao, Assistant Professor of Chemistry and Biological Sciences, at the University of Illinois Chicago, is one of three researchers recently selected to receive funding from the McKnight Endowment Fund for Neuroscience, which…

Professor Lev Reyzin and others awarded $10 million 5-year NSF grant to establish Institute for Data, Econometrics, Algorithms and Learning (IDEAL)

A multidisciplinary team representing five Chicago-area university research centers will unite as part of a new data science institute backed by a five-year, $10 million grant from the National Science Foundation. Professor of…

AP of Chemistry Meenesh Singh's research team receive grants to decarbonize cement manufacturing

Chemical engineers at the University of Illinois Chicago are investigating new methods to reduce carbon dioxide emissions from cement manufacturing. Now, thanks to two federal grant awards, UIC researchers and their collaborators from…
